title: 111_hr2667
content: The "Early Support for Families Act" establishes grants for quality home visitation programs for families with young children and expecting families under the Social Security Act. The section aims to enhance child well-being by supporting quality voluntary home visitation programs for families with young children and expecting families. States seeking grants must submit applications detailing these programs. The section requires states to submit grant applications for high-quality home visitation programs for families with young children and expecting families, including program descriptions, intended outcomes, and evidence of effectiveness. Additionally, states must provide the results of a statewide needs assessment. The grant made to the State under this section will support families with young children and expecting children. The statewide needs assessment will describe the number and quality of home visitation programs for eligible families receiving services. The statewide needs assessment will describe the number, quality, and capacity of home visitation programs for families with young children and expecting children in the State, including gaps in services and funding sources.
